#summary Getting started

We discussed about [SoYouHaveAnIdea putting an application ideas in writing] and [VisualizingYourApp how to further clarify stories] we plan to implement. [TheRightToolForTheJob Having settled on GWT/GAE], we'll look briefly at how to get started with development environment.

= Environment Setup =

Setup [http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/ Java]

Setup [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/usingeclipse.html Eclipse]

== Useful Eclipse plugins ==
[http://m2eclipse.sonatype.org/ Maven integration]

[http://eclipse-cs.sourceforge.net/ Checkstyle]

== Useful Eclipse preferences ==
Window > Preferences > Java > Editor > Save actions > Format source code


= Getting Started =

Go through 
 * [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/doc/latest/tutorial/gettingstarted.html GWT Getting Started tutorial]
 * [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/doc/latest/DevGuideOrganizingProjects.html Organizing Projects]
 * [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/doc/latest/DevGuideCompilingAndDebugging.html Compiling and Debugging]
 * [http://code.google.com/webtoolkit/doc/latest/DevGuideUi.html Building User Interfaces]

See you in a few days :)

= Application source code =
<img src="http://gwt-gae-book.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/digital_dreams.jpg" border="0"  align="right" />

[http://code.google.com/p/gwt-gae-book/source/checkout Checkout the latest source code] for the application developed along the book, or [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-gae-book/downloads/list download an archive]. We'll go along building the whole app together, so it's ok if not all the code makes sense now :)

Known issue: Eclipse shows an error on HeaderView.ui.xml, [http://code.google.com/p/google-web-toolkit/issues/detail?id=5453 this is a known GWT bug]. The project compiles and runs fine though.

Here's  [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-gae-book/downloads/detail?name=CultureShows-allow-anonymous-scheduling.tgz&can=2&q= an archive] with an intermediary application source code, for your convenience. Please ignore this for now, we will develop it as we progress through book chapters.

= Useful libraries =
We'll use a few libraries in our project:
 * [http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/ guava]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/google-guice/ guice] 
 * [http://code.google.com/p/google-gin/ gin]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-platform/ gwt-platform]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-dnd/ gwt-dnd]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwtquery/ gwtquery]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/twig-persist/ twig-persist]
 * [http://mockito.org/ mockito]

Visit these project sites to find out more about them. Come back to their documentation whenever needed as we progress with our application.

 * [http://getfirebug.com/ Firebug] and [http://www.softwareishard.com/blog/firecookie/ Firecookie]
